meanings.definition: To throw or toss something upward.
meanings.sent1: She decided to upfling the ball into the air.
meanings.sent2: He upflings the frisbee to his friend at the park.
meanings.sent3: The magician upflinged the scarf, making it disappear into thin air.
meanings.sent4: With a flick of his wrist, he upflinged the coin into the fountain for good luck.
meanings.sent5: The child upflinged the kite, watching it soar high in the sky.

meanings.definition: A sudden upward movement or motion.
meanings.sent1: The bird's upfling caught everyone's attention as it soared above the trees.
meanings.sent2: The balloon's upfling surprised the children as it rose swiftly into the sky.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected upfling of the rocket made the crowd gasp in amazement.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's graceful upfling added a touch of elegance to the performance.
meanings.sent5: The hot air balloon's upfling was a breathtaking sight against the sunset.
